bibl.title: Two 'Double' Dedications at Ephesus and the Beginning of Ptolemaic Control of Ionia.
bibl.note: Reconsiders the texts of two inscriptions found in the Austrian excavations at Ephesus in Hanghaus II: I. Ephesos II, 199, and S.E.G. XXXIII, 942. The texts belong to the reign of Ptolemy IV Philopator. - Avec résumés en anglais et en turc.

bibl.title: Gephyra. Journal for the Ancient History and Cultures of the Eastern Mediterranean

bibl.seg: Andrew Meadows, Two 'Double' Dedications at Ephesus and the Beginning of Ptolemaic Control of Ionia.
Gephyra. Journal for the Ancient History and Cultures of the Eastern Mediterranean [Istanbul] 10 (2013) pp. 1-12, 1 fig.

Reconsiders the texts of two inscriptions found in the Austrian excavations at Ephesus in Hanghaus II: I. Ephesos II, 199, and S.E.G. XXXIII, 942. The texts belong to the reign of Ptolemy IV Philopator. - Avec résumés en anglais et en turc.
